question: What are the most common neuropsychiatric disorders associated with Duchenne muscular dystrophy?
ideal_answer: The most common neuropsychiatric disorders associated with Duchenne muscular dystrophy are autism spectrum disorders (ASDs), epilepsy, attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), depression, anxiety disorders and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
